channel.title: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!
channel.description:
[ul][li]This will only work if your school uses [b]www.studyisland.com[/b] in classes, you cannot do this. And i have [b]Tested[/b] this at school, that is how i discovered it. **Note: This will work on anything, i'm just using studyisland.com b/c that is how i found this and most schools use this during a computer time. [/li][/ul]
[b] Something to know:[/b] Everytime i get a chance i screw a computer at school, and then the next day i'll go to use the same computer and ask the teacher what is wrong with it and ask the teacher to fix it when i know how.
[b]1. [/b]Ok to start, open up your browser either log onto studyisland and start a quiz, or google something and go to images. [b]2. [/b]Second, Just right click the image and select "save as" and you should have access to anything from there like i did. I was able to go into "C:/" and " All Programs" Which you cannot usually have access to, if this does not work for you, your teachers are smarter than the average teacher dumber than a donkey in "US schools".
[b]If you did not understand any of this here is a picture.[/b] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img140.imageshack.us/img140/8826/69151369xk7.png[/img][/URL]
[b]Credits: 50%, Me 40% My teachers for being to stupid to block this, 10% And You risking getting expelled for attempting to do this.[/b]

item.title: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

jdsd:

untill i took the pictures and got him suspended that is.

Wtf?

Read full topic
item.source: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!

item.title: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!
item.dc:creator: @jdsd jdsd
item.description:
@jdsd wrote:

[quote=“script_owned4, post:19, topic:159550”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=217266.msg1901785#msg1901785 date=1196156489]
I really don’t care anyhow, With firefox’s extensions their little web blocker is useless lol.
[/quote]
Sadly, they use internet explorer in our school.

Our school has a high restriction to any bad websites…Like even google images are blocked, miniclip(I know it’s useless), and couple others.

I highly doubt this guide will work for most since they can’t ussually access their Program Files…

Another way (if they have restrictions) is you can look at your internet connections and choose the one that is not the school one (if you have more than 1 internet connections obviouslly) and they probably don’t have restrictions.[/quote]

Just go to hidemylocation.com it lets you go anywhere, my computer class is half the school day so I do the work that takes 5 mins then do whatever like go on myspace or mopar or anything else.

And once I told one of the 8th graders at my school how to do this and he started to print pr0n pics from the internet, the teacher was reading so he got away with it…untill i took the pictures and got him suspended that is.

Read full topic

Well,I wouldn’t Hack a computer at school-I’d get caught.[/quote]

You barely know what hacking is. Rule 2.

item.source: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!

item.title: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!
item.dc:creator: @iron_man_ftw iron man ftw
item.description:
@iron_man_ftw wrote:

My school has Websense or something like that.

My school made the mistake of making “My Computer” in desktop. It has everyone that has ever logged into that computer’s file. I can delete anyones files. Only deleted someone’s file once, it was a small file that barely ment anything (just to test if it works or not.)

After Christmas break I am going to make one of those batch files where it deletes your entire computer pretty much.

@echo off del "C:\WINDOWS"
Sorry for posting a batch file thingy, just had to say what i was going to do :(.

If that works, i’ll see what i can do from there.

Read full topic
item.source: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!

item.title: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

my schools security breakdown:

Deepfreeze protects all computers (so any settings or files deleted are restored on reboot)
Websense powers our proxy http://www.websense.com/global/en/
Novell manages all our login info

ALL internet traffic is logged downtown and kept track of (friend got called down and they had page upon page upon page of nothing but urls he went to (my proxy encrypts my urls and password protected so I am probably safe unless they go and monitor my post data))

SUPPOSEDLY every computer is monitored downtown and has remote access (it is configured to have remote access, I have seen the setup information on it) yet never heard of it actually get used.

But due to my entire school is one big network and every computer has itunes I listen to my teachers music on other computers

There is a breakdown of my security. Most settings are locked but they dont matter due to deepfreeze.

p.s. they also monitor searches actively
person googled proxy (they are dumb) and were called down the next day or so

Read full topic

item.title: A New way to hack a school computer... No batch files or programs!
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

deoxys505:

real easy to hack. go to internet explorer and type in ‘C:’ witout the quotes. then hit enter. if you can’t access C: by doing that then your unlucky. on my school computer we had access to everything except blocked sites. i even had access to regedit and cmd. and i could use most cmd commands and change almost everything with regedit. quite fun. we could even change our de3sktop pics and themes. quite nice of them. in the library we could login with our own username and password precreated for us. but those had less freedom. we could still change our desktop and themes and stuff tho.

All schools use different blocks. So your right and wrong

Read full topic
